# complement determinants

Words are often spelled out with different readings to the determinant:

𓇥 𓂋 𓇋 𓇋 𓏏 𓅭 kite (krait √cry)
𓇥 𓂋 𓏏 𓅃 kite

𓆈 | dove | ⋍ •salampati 🕊 sarampati! > columbus saeampati 𒋧𒈠𒌅 sum-ma-tu “dove” ⇔ 𒋎 ŠEMBULUGX
𒋧 𒈠𒌅 šum-ma-tu 🕊 𓏠 𓈖 𓏌 𓏏 𓅭 ǧumen-pato : 𒋧𒈠𒌅 sum-ma-tu saeampati@Austronesian 🕊 sarampati ⇔ Malay merpati
𒋧𒈠𒌅 sum-ma-tu saeampati sarampati •salampati 𓆈 | dove | 🕊 salam
𒋧𒈠𒌅 šum-ma-tu sarampati < •çorumpati > columbus +++!?

𓃀 𓇋 𓅱 𓆤 𓏨 | wasp | Biene ! +++ DE ← / biün / bien see 𓅱
𓃀 𓅡 𓄿 𓇋 𓇋 𓊗 𓏮 𓏲 𓅭 | wasp | bvásp vespa (𓊃𓊪𓊗 spät) ☑ ⇔ bee ⇔ 𓅭ben/bint/bat (son/daughter)

𓃀 𓅡 𓄿 𓎛 𓂺 phallus, penis 𓂸 ⇔ phoenix 𓅡

𓅓 𓈙 𓂝 𓏏 𓈎 𓍜 | shoulder (blade) | ⲙⲟⲩⲧ moⲩt ( ⲟ ⋍ σ ) ⋍
𓄡 𓈎 𓇋 𓇋 𓄹 | shoulder (blade) |

𓍜 (shoulder) blade 𒁍𒁺 pu-du •blade
𓍜 shoulder (blade) 𒁍𒁺 pu-du плечо plečo плешка pleška épaule spatule spart

The complement reading of 𓈎 𓍜 can be inferred:
𓈎 𓂝 𓎛 𓂢 𓄹 | elbow, arm, shoulder |

words often had mixed sounds and aligned meanings between languages:

𓇓 sultan سُلْت sult 𓇔 rye raj Roggen regent

𓅭𓇳 sen sun son
𓅭𓇳 gans güne gens
𓅭𓏏 baṭi beti putra …
𓅭𓏏 duck daughter …

𓄿 𓊪 𓂧 𓅬 | duck, bird | Erpel a'pato 𓅭𓏏

very strong Aᵐ M complement dialectic

𒀉𒄣𒊒 •šōb-qu-ru ⋍ Schöpfkelle “spoon” < ϣⲱⲃ šōbᵒⁿ
𒀉𒄣𒊒 ᵐ-qu-ru ⇔ مغرفة mḡarfa “spoon” чӏакъв č'aq'w

𓆈 ⇔ 𓆊

breaking forced associations

in times when syllabic signs and the letters of the alphabet where not abstract but defined through their ( rebus ) root, naturally all words using those signs became strongly associated. This was sometimes alleviated through complement orthograpyh:

Some words especially in later times seem to be spelled out explicitly with breaking boundaries.
Made up example:
remind => rem + ind

complement vs lost etymology

It is astonishing that Egyptians didn't write carpet with 𓃀 even though the root √ⲫⲁⲧ matches perfectly:
𓂓 𓏤 𓅷 𓏤 𓍘 𓇋 𓍱 𓏪 ⲕⲟⲩⲫⲁⲧ carpet ⲩ wanderword

𒉅 bur₅ /bir/ bird <> locust in 𓅭 𓈖 𓈟 𓄿 | locust | саранча́ sarančá скака́лец skakálec karkalec Kakalaken! kulkusirkka
𓊃 𓈖 𓈟 𓅓 | locust | 𓆧

𒄞 GUD ≈ DUG 𒋭 good DUG₃TA 𒄭𒋫 "sweet, honey, syrup" #LAL lolly 𒋭 𒋫𒄭 TA•ḪI ≈ top ţābu (good) 𒋫𒁍 ṭabu "top" good, sweet 𒋫𒄭 ṭābum “pleasant”
𒋭 TA•ḪIᵐ ⵜⴰⵎⵎⵏⵜ tammnt "honey" 𒄭 ḪIⁿ 𓆤 𓏏 𓏌 𓏥 𒋭 ţābu ≈ dišpu 𒁹𒁍 diš-puʳ debora ܕܒܫܐ deḇšā דְּבַשׁ dvash bee-honey, syrup

𒉀 ˢnaĝa ˢnang أُشْنَان ʔušnān "potash, soap" <> WaschLaugen 𒉀 ˢnama 𒈾𒈠 na-ma s'nama ሳሙና samuna shampoo صابون ṣabūn "soap" 𒉀𒋢𒌒 naĝa su-ub 𒉀𒋳 naĝa sub₆ "rub with soap" complement

𒅗 KIR₄ ≈ 𒅮 Kröte 𓆏 in 𓈙 𓏏 𓅂 𓆉 schildpad 𒊺𒈜𒁍 #šeleppû 𒃻𒅮𒈾 •šáˡbuna ≈ 𒊺𒂗𒅮𒈾 še-en-bun₂na
